intro: Fimbristylis boeckeleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in wetlands and marshy environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
